src:
Liverpools utrolige rekke fortsetter
Liverpool slo Sander Berges Genk og har n√• 24 Europa-kamper p√• rad uten tap p√• Anfield.
05 Nov 2019, 22:06 by NTB

LIVERPOOL - GENK 2‚Äì1

Med seieren st√•r Liverpool med ni poeng etter fire kamper i gruppe E. Sander Berge og Genk blir st√•ende med sitt ene.

‚Äì Det var fint √• bidra med et m√•l. Det betyr mye for selvtilliten, og hvordan du f√∏ler deg. Jeg er glad for hvordan dette gikk. Vi trengte tre poeng, og klarte det til slutt, sa Oxlade-Chamberlain i et intervju vist p√• Viasat.

‚Äì Vi hadde mange sjanser, og seieren kunne v√¶rt st√∏rre, men de er et godt lag som gjorde det vanskelig fos oss. Det viktigste var uansett seieren, supplerte lagkamerat James Milner.

‚Äì Vi gjennomf√∏rte en god kamp. Vi l√• under med ett m√•l med et par minutter igjen √• spille, og holdt p√• √• sette 2‚Äì2. Det var et scenario jeg ikke hadde sett for meg p√• forh√•nd. De kunne ha scoret flere, men slik er det p√• Anfield. De kj√∏rer over alle lag her. Vi er med hele veien, og fikk vist oss frem. Det gir selvtillit inn mot hjemlig liga, sier Sander Berge til TV 2.

Det s√• til at det skulle bli den engelske kattens lek med den belgiske musa da Liverpool tok imot Genk p√• Anfield tirsdag. Sander Berge og hans lagkamerater ble til tider filleristet av et offensivt hjemmelag, som brukte 14 minutter p√• √• ta ledelsen.

Da hadde James Milner sl√•tt en knallhard ball inn i feltet fra vestre kant som spratt opp i brystet p√• S√©bastien Dewaest og ned i beina p√• Georginio Wijnaldum. Nederlenderen pirket ballen opp i nettaket, og Liverpool hadde f√•tt en dr√∏mmestart mot belgierne.

Hjemmelaget fortsatte r√•kj√∏ret, og det var til tider enveiskj√∏ring p√• Anfield. Liverpool skapte sjanse p√• sjanse. Divock Origi, Mohamed Salah og Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain kom seg til store sjanser, men ballen forsvant p√• utsiden av stengene.

Rekord-Haaland fortsatte m√•lshowet i Champions League: ‚Äì Et m√•lmonster uten like


Fakta: Champions League menn tirsdag, 4. runde:

Gruppe E:



Liverpool ‚Äì Genk 2-1 (1-1)


M√•l: 1-0 Georginio Wijnaldum (14), 1-1 Mbwana Samatta (40), 2-1 Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (53).


Napoli ‚Äì Salzburg 1-1 (1-1)


M√•l: 0-1 Erling Braut Haaland (str. 11), 1-1 Hirving Lozano (44).

Gruppe F:



Barcelona ‚Äì Slavia Praha 0-0 (0-0)




Borussia Dortmund ‚Äì Inter 3-2 (0-2)


M√•l: 0-1 Lautaro Mart√≠nez (5), 0-2 Mat√≠as Vecino (40), 1-2 Achraf Hakimi (51), 2-2 Julian Brandt (64), 3-2 Hakimi (77).

Gruppe G:



Zenit St. Petersburg ‚Äì RB Leipzig 0-2 (0-1)


M√•l: 0-1 Diego Demme (45), 0-2 Marcel Sabitzer (63).


Lyon ‚Äì Benfica 3-1 (2-0)


M√•l: 1-0 Joachim Andersen (4), 2-0 Memphis Depay (33), 2-1 Haris Seferoviƒá (76), 3-1 Bertrand Traor√© (89).

Gruppe H:



Chelsea ‚Äì Ajax 4-4 (1-3)


M√•l: 0-1 Tammy Abraham (selvm√•l 2), 1-1 Jorginho (str. 4), 1-2 Quincy Promes (20), 1-3 Kepa (selvm√•l 35), 1-4 Donny van de Beek (55), 2-4 C√©sar Azpilicueta (63), 3-4 Jorginho (str. 71), 4-4 Reece James (74).


Valencia ‚Äì Lille 4-1 (0-1)


M√•l: 0-1 Victor Osimhen (25), 1-1 Dani Parejo (str. 66), 2-1 Adama Soumaoro (selvm√•l 82), 3-1 Geoffrey Kondogbia (84), 4-1 Ferran Torres (90).



Liverpools Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain scoret det avgj√∏rende m√•let i Champions League-kampen mot Genk.üì∑ Jon Super / AP

Sjansesl√∏seri
Liverpools sjansesl√∏seri skulle vise seg √• bli kostbart f√∏r pause, for gjestenes Mbwana Samatta trengte kun √©n sjanse p√• √• utligne.

Helt mot spillets gang stanget 26-√•ringen fra Tanzania ballen bak Alisson i Liverpool-buret. Scoringen kom etter en corner fire minutter f√∏r hvilen.

Liverpool fortsatte hardkj√∏ret mot Genk innledningsvis i annen omgang, og igjen fikk de betalt med scoring. Oxlade-Chamberlain, som ogs√• scoret i det forrige oppgj√∏ret, f√∏rte vertene opp i 2-1 da han p√• mesterlig vis vendte bort sin oppasser i feltet og banket ballen i nettet.

Da var Liverpool p√• god vei mot sin 24. ubeseirede europeiske kamp p√• rad p√• Anfield. Den imponerende rekken lyder n√• 17 seirer, seks uavgjort og null tap.


To kamper p√• ett d√∏gn: Dette er Liverpools uvanlige l√∏sning

Fortsatte storml√∏pet
J√ºrgen Klopps menn slapp ikke foten av gassen og fortsatte storml√∏pet mot Ga√´tan Coucke i Genk-m√•let. Men som i f√∏rste omgang skulle det bli en tung √∏velse √• f√• ballen i m√•l. Salah hadde en kjempesjanse til √• √∏ke ledelsen halvtimen f√∏r slutt, men alene med keeper leverte egypteren et skikkelig sleivspark.

Ogs√• Wijnaldum og Alexander-Arnold kom til gode skuddmuligheter, men ingen av fors√∏kene fant veien bak Coucke.

√Ötte minutter f√∏r slutt kom Genk seg til sjansen de ventet p√•, men Bryan Heynens skuddfors√∏k fra skr√•tt hold ble reddet av Liverpools keeper.

Barcelona snublet i Champions League

N√¶r utligning
Genk l√∏ftet laget h√∏yere opp p√• banen i jakten p√• utligning og var igjen n√¶re tre minutter senere etter en d√∏dball, men igjen fikk hjemmelagets forsvar ryddet unna.

Flere m√•l ble det ikke og det var ikke ufortjent at de tre poengene blir igjen p√• Anfield. Sander Berges Genk skal ha for fors√∏ket, men poeng ble det ikke.

I neste runde tar Liverpool imot Napoli p√• Anfield, mens Genk m√∏ter Salzburg.
text:
Liverpool's incredible array continues
Liverpool beat Sander Berges Genk and now have 24 consecutive European matches without loss at Anfield.
05 Nov 2019, 22:06 by NTB

LIVERPOOL - GENK 2‚Äì1

With the victory, Liverpool stands nine points after four matches in Group E. Sander Berge and Genk remain standing with their one.

- It was nice to contribute a goal. It means a lot to self-confidence and how you feel. I'm glad how this went. We needed three points, and we finally managed, Oxlade-Chamberlain said in an interview shown on Viasat.

- We had a lot of chances and the win could have been bigger, but they are a good team that made it difficult for us. The most important thing was whatever the win, added teammate James Milner.

- We made a good fight. We were down by one goal with a couple of minutes left to play, and kept putting 2-2. It was a scenario I had not imagined beforehand. They could have scored more, but that's the way it is at Anfield. They run across all teams here. We are with you all the way, and got to show off. It gives confidence to the home league, Sander Berge told TV 2.

It looked like it would be the English cat's game with the Belgian muse when Liverpool welcomed Genk at Anfield on Tuesday. Sander Berge and his teammates were sometimes shaken off by an offensive home team, who spent 14 minutes taking the lead.

By then James Milner had hit a fierce ball into the field from the west edge that popped up in the chest of S√©bastien Dewaest and down into the legs of Georginio Wijnaldum. The Dutchman pushed the ball into the net and Liverpool had a dream start against the Belgians.

The home team continued the raw drive, and it was one-way at times at Anfield. Liverpool created chance on chance. Divock Origi, Mohamed Salah and Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain had great chances, but the ball disappeared on the outside of the bars.

Record-Haaland continued the Champions League goal show: - A goal monster without equal


Facts: Men's Champions League Tuesday, Round 4:

Group E:



Liverpool - Genk 2-1 (1-1)


Goals: 1-0 Georginio Wijnaldum (14), 1-1 Mbwana Samatta (40), 2-1 Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (53).


Naples - Salzburg 1-1 (1-1)


Goals: 0-1 Erling Braut Haaland (size 11), 1-1 Hirving Lozano (44).

Group F:



Barcelona - Slavia Praha 0-0 (0-0)




Borussia Dortmund - Inter 3-2 (0-2)


Goals: 0-1 Lautaro Mart√≠nez (5), 0-2 Mat√≠as Vecino (40), 1-2 Achraf Hakimi (51), 2-2 Julian Brandt (64), 3-2 Hakimi (77).

Group G:



Zenit St. Petersburg - RB Leipzig 0-2 (0-1)


Goals: 0-1 Diego Demme (45), 0-2 Marcel Sabitzer (63).


Lyon - Benfica 3-1 (2-0)


Goals: 1-0 Joachim Andersen (4), 2-0 Memphis Depay (33), 2-1 Haris Seferoviƒá (76), 3-1 Bertrand Traor√© (89).

Group H:



Chelsea - Ajax 4-4 (1-3)


Goals: 0-1 Tammy Abraham (goal 2), 1-1 Jorginho (size 4), 1-2 Quincy Promes (20), 1-3 Kepa (goal 35), 1-4 Donny van de Beek (55) , 2-4 C√©sar Azpilicueta (63), 3-4 Jorginho (str. 71), 4-4 Reece James (74).


Valencia - Small 4-1 (0-1)


Goals: 0-1 Victor Osimhen (25), 1-1 Dani Parejo (size 66), 2-1 Adama Soumaoro (goal 82), 3-1 Geoffrey Kondogbia (84), 4-1 Ferran Torres (90).



Liverpool's Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain scored the decisive goal in the Champions League match against Genk.üì∑ Jon Super / AP

chance Waste
Liverpool's chance of losing should prove costly before the break, as Mbwana Samatta's guests needed only one chance to equalize.

All the way to the game, the 26-year-old from Tanzania put the ball behind Alisson in the Liverpool cage. The scoring came after a corner four minutes before the rest.

Liverpool continued the hard drive against Genk initially in the second half, and again they got paid with scoring. Oxlade-Chamberlain, who also scored in the previous settlement, led the hosts up 2-1 as he masterfully turned away his keeper in the field and knocked the ball into the net.

Then Liverpool were well on their way to their 24th undefeated European match in a row at Anfield. The impressive series now sounds 17 wins, six draws and zero losses.


Two matches in one day: This is Liverpool's unusual solution

Continued the rush
J√ºrgen Klopp's men did not let go of the gas and continued the rush against Ga√´tan Coucke in the Genk goal. But as in the first place, getting the ball in goal would be a heavy exercise. Salah had a great chance to increase the lead half an hour before the end, but alone with the keeper, the Egyptian delivered a decent leash kick.

Wijnaldum and Alexander-Arnold also had good shooting opportunities, but none of the attempts found their way behind Coucke.

Eight minutes before Genk finally got the chance they were waiting for, but Bryan Heynen's shot from the oblique shot was saved by Liverpool's keeper.

Barcelona stumbled into the Champions League

Close to equalization
Genk lifted the team higher up the field in search of equalization and was again close to three minutes later after a dead ball, but again the home team's defense cleared away.

There were no more goals and it was not undeserved that the three points remain at Anfield. Sander Berges Genk should have for the trial, but points were not.

In the next round, Liverpool will take on Naples at Anfield, while Genk will face Salzburg.
